open_questions.title: What AWS is and its core
open_questions.description: Explain what AWS is and its core services.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain what AWS is and its core services.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: AWS stands for Amazon Web Services, and it is a cloud computing platform that provides a wide range of cloud services, including computing power, storage, databases, machine learning, analytics, and more. Some core services include EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud), S3 (Simple Storage Service), RDS (Relational Database Service), and Lambda for serverless computing.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The advantages of using AWS over
open_questions.description: What are the advantages of using AWS over traditional on-premises infrastructure?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What are the advantages of using AWS over traditional on-premises infrastructure?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: AWS offers several advantages, such as scalability, cost-effectiveness, flexibility, and the ability to pay only for what you use. It also provides a global network of data centers, which ensures high availability and reliability.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The difference between horizontal scaling and
open_questions.description: What is the difference between horizontal scaling and vertical scaling in AWS?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the difference between horizontal scaling and vertical scaling in AWS?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Horizontal scaling, also known as scaling out, involves adding more instances or servers to your application to handle increased load. Vertical scaling, or scaling up, involves increasing the resources (e.g., CPU, RAM) of existing instances to handle more load. AWS provides tools and services like Auto Scaling to facilitate horizontal scaling.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The Amazon DynamoDB database and how
open_questions.description: What is the Amazon DynamoDB database and how does it work?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the Amazon DynamoDB database and how does it work?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database service provided by AWS. It is designed for high availability and scalability. DynamoDB uses a distributed architecture where data is partitioned and replicated across multiple servers to ensure high performance and fault tolerance.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Shared
open_questions.description: What is the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Shared Responsibility Model?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the Amazon Web Services (AWS) Shared Responsibility Model?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: The AWS Shared Responsibility Model defines the division of responsibilities between AWS and its customers. AWS is responsible for the security "of" the cloud (physical infrastructure, networking, and some aspects of the host operating system), while customers are responsible for the security "in" the cloud (configuring security groups, managing access control, securing their own applications, etc.).
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: What AWS Lambda is and its

referenceAnswers.text: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that allows you to run code in response to events without managing servers. It is used for various tasks, including data processing, real-time file processing, and building serverless applications.

open_questions.title: What AWS EC2 is and its

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon EC2 is a versatile service that enables users to run virtual servers in the cloud, making it suitable for a wide range of use cases, from hosting websites to running complex data analytics and machine learning workloads. Its scalability and pay-as-you-go pricing model make it a valuable resource for businesses of all sizes.

open_questions.title: The difference between EC2 and Lambda,
open_questions.description: What is the difference between EC2 and Lambda, and when would you choose one over the other for a specific use case?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is the difference between EC2 and Lambda, and when would you choose one over the other for a specific use case?" open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) provides virtual machines that you manage, while AWS Lambda is a serverless service where you upload code, and AWS manages the infrastructure. Choose EC2 for more control and flexibility and Lambda for event-driven, highly scalable, and cost-efficient workloads.

Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: Auto Scaling, and how does it

referenceAnswers.text: Auto Scaling is a feature in AWS that allows you to automatically adjust the number of EC2 instances in a group based on demand. It uses scaling policies and metrics to determine when to add or remove instances to maintain a desired level of capacity and availability.

open_questions.title: Es Amazon S3 achieve high availability
open_questions.description: How does Amazon S3 achieve high availability and durability?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "How does Amazon S3 achieve high availability and durability?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service) achieves high availability and durability by replicating data across multiple data centers within an AWS region. It uses object-level versioning, automatically handles hardware failures, and provides data integrity through checksums.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: You ensure the security of data
open_questions.description: How do you ensure the security of data stored in Amazon S3 buckets?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "How do you ensure the security of data stored in Amazon S3 buckets?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: You can ensure the security of data in Amazon S3 buckets by: Setting appropriate bucket policies and access control lists (ACLs). Enabling versioning and MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) delete. Using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles and policies. Encrypting data at rest using server-side encryption (SSE). Using VPC endpoints and S3 bucket policies for fine-grained control. Regularly reviewing access logs and monitoring with AWS CloudWatch.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.title: A CDN (Content Delivery Network).
open_questions.description: What is a CDN (Content Delivery Network).?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "What is a CDN (Content Delivery Network).?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: A CDN is a distributed network of servers located at various geographic locations. Its primary purpose is to improve the speed, reliability, and availability of web content, such as images, videos, and static files. CDNs cache content close to end-users, reducing latency and offloading traffic from origin servers. This results in faster content delivery and better scalability, especially for global audiences.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

open_questions.description: What is Amazon Elastic Load Balancing (ELB), and how does it work?

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon ELB is a service that automatically distributes incoming application traffic across multiple targets, such as EC2 instances, to ensure high availability and fault tolerance. It works by regularly monitoring the health of instances and routing traffic only to healthy targets.

open_questions.title: Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service), and

open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon SQS is a managed message queuing service that decouples the components of a cloud application. Amazon SNS is a fully managed notification service. While SQS allows messages to be stored temporarily until processed, SNS is used for real-time message delivery to multiple subscribers.

open_questions.title: The difference between Amazon RDS and

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon RDS (Relational Database Service) is a managed relational database service that supports multiple database engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server. It's suitable for structured data and offers features like automatic backups and scaling. Amazon DynamoDB, on the other hand, is a managed NoSQL database service that provides high scalability, low latency, and seamless replication. It's ideal for applications requiring flexible and fast data access.

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon S3 offers several storage classes, including Standard, Intelligent-Tiering, One Zone-IA, Glacier, and Glacier Deep Archive. open_questions.title: The benefits of using Amazon Lambda
open_questions.description: Explain the benefits of using Amazon Lambda in serverless application architectures.?

Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: Amazon Lambda is a serverless compute service that automatically scales based on the workload. It eliminates the need to manage servers and infrastructure, enabling developers to focus on writing code. Lambda can be used for various tasks, including event-driven functions and backend processing.

open_questions.title: The AWS Lambda execution environment and
open_questions.description: Explain the AWS Lambda execution environment and its lifecycle.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a junior-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the AWS Lambda execution environment and its lifecycle.?" Requirements: - Define the concept in your own words - Give a small example - Mention a common pitfall or best practice Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the concept in your own words; Give a small example; Mention a common pitfall or best practice. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: AWS Lambda execution environments are preconfigured containers that run your Lambda functions. The lifecycle involves: Initialization: AWS creates a new execution environment if one is not available. Invocation: Your Lambda function is triggered by an event. Execution: Your code runs and processes the event. Cleanup: AWS may reuse the environment for subsequent invocations or terminate it.
keyPoints: Define the concept in your own words
Give a small example
Mention a common pitfall or best practice

referenceAnswers.text: Serverless computing in AWS, often associated with AWS Lambda, is a cloud computing model where you don't need to provision or manage servers. Instead, you focus on writing code in response to events. AWS Lambda automatically scales your code in response to incoming requests and charges you only for the compute time used.

referenceAnswers.text: You can manage secrets and sensitive information in AWS applications by using AWS Secrets Manager for storing and rotating secrets (e.g., API keys, database credentials), or AWS Systems Manager Parameter Store for storing configuration data securely. open_questions.title: CORS
open_questions.description: Explain the concept of Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) and how it is relevant in AWS.?
open_questions.prompt: You are evaluating a mid-level candidate. Answer the question: "Explain the concept of Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) and how it is relevant in AWS.?" Requirements: - Define the vulnerability and the attack vector - Concrete prevention/mitigation techniques Style: - Clear, structured, concise. - Use code snippets only if they add clarity. - Avoid vague statements.
open_questions.aiEvaluationHint: Expect the answer to address: Define the vulnerability and the attack vector; Concrete prevention/mitigation techniques. Penalize answers that miss key requirements.

referenceAnswers.text: CORS is a security feature implemented by web browsers to control requests made to different origins (domains). In AWS, you may encounter CORS issues when you have web applications hosted on S3 or API Gateway. You configure CORS to specify which origins are allowed to access your resources, helping to prevent unauthorized cross-origin requests.
keyPoints: Define the vulnerability and the attack vector
